title: Mars Atmospheric Data Analysis and Modelling
description: Organization National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) Reference Code 0008-NPP-NOV24-JPL-PlanetSci How To Apply All applications must be submitted in Zintellect Please visit the NASA Postdoctoral Program website for application instructions and requirements: How to Apply | NASA Postdoctoral Program (orau.org) A complete application to the NASA Postdoctoral Program includes: Research proposal Three letters of recommendation Official doctoral transcript documents Application Deadline 11/1/2024 6:00:59 PM Eastern Time Zone Description About the NASA Postdoctoral Program The NASA Postdoctoral Program (NPP) offers unique research opportunities to highly-talented U.S. and non-U.S. scientists to engage in ongoing NASA research projects at a NASA Center, NASA Headquarters, or at a NASA-affiliated research institute. These one- to three-year fellowships are competitive and are designed to advance NASA’s missions in space science, Earth science, aeronautics, space operations, exploration systems, and astrobiology. Description: The successful post-doc will participate in a program which focuses on understanding the Martian atmosphere, its variability, and its interaction with the surface through observing and/or modeling its primary traceable constituents, water vapor, water-ice and dust, and observing or modeling related surface features. The post-doc will be expected to analyze and synthesize data from Mars orbiters and landers and/or conduct relevant modeling studies. The primary goals of this program include gaining insight into (1) the character of and changes in the atmosphere on diurnal, seasonal, interannual, and longer timescales, (2) the current climate regime, its history and evolution, and (3) the nature of the water cycle and its relationship to long term sources and sinks. Thus, the post-doc would likely conduct a combination of modeling studies and data analyses, possibly including modeling climate evolution. Any modeling studies would be constrained by and validated against appropriate existing data that the post-doc would analyze. Data analysis projects would be used to examine and compare data sets to search for trends and differences spatially and temporally. Examples of recent work: Tamppari, L. K., and M. T. Lemmon, 2020. Near-Surface atmospheric water vapor enhancement at Phoenix, Icarus, 343, 113624, https://doi.org/10.1016/j.icarus.2020.113624 Savijärvi, H. I., G. M. Martinez, E. Fischer, N. O. Renno, L. K. Tamppari, A. Zent, and A.-M. Harri, 2020. Humidity observations and column simulations for a warm period at the Mars Phoenix lander site: constraining the adsorptive properties of regolith, Icarus,343, 113688, DOI: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.icarus.2020.113688 Location: Jet Propulsion Laboratory Pasadena, California Field of Science: Planetary Science Advisors: Leslie Tamppari Leslie.K.Tamppari@jpl.nasa.gov 818-393-1226 Applications with citizens from Designated Countries will not be accepted at this time, unless they are Legal Permanent Residents of the United States. A complete list of Designated Countries can be found at: https://www.nasa.gov/oiir/export-control. Eligibility is currently open to: U.S. Citizens; U.S. Lawful Permanent Residents (LPR); Foreign Nationals eligible for an Exchange Visitor J-1 visa status; and, Applicants for LPR, asylees, or refugees in the U.S. at the time of application with 1) a valid EAD card and 2) I-485 or I-589 forms in pending status Questions about this opportunity? Please email npp@orau.org Eligibility Requirements Degree: Doctoral Degree.

title: Geopolitical Intelligence Analyst
description: Are you interested in joining an organization with a global reach? At Concentric, “We Manage Risk Everywhere to Keep People Safe.” If you are passionate about intelligence, risk analysis, threat management, executive protection, security operations, or business resiliency, Concentric may be the organization you’ve been searching for! Concentric is a risk consultancy specializing in delivering strategic security and intelligence services. We provide holistic, intelligent security solutions for private clients and corporations globally. Concentric offers strategic advisory services, risk assessments, physical protection, threat intelligence, open-source monitoring, program audits, secure embedded staffing, and training for security teams and intelligence analysts. Our ultimate goal is to be recognized as the most innovative, capable, and trusted Risk Management partner in the world, and we do this by following these core values: Integrity – Collaboration - Relationships – Excellence – Creativity - Results We are currently looking to hire a Geopolitical Intelligence Analyst to join our team embedded with our client in Culver City! This position requires working a hybrid schedule from our client's Headquarters in Culver City, CA. JOB DESCRIPTION This position provides rapid assessments of potentially imminent local, domestic, and international security situations, sensitive developments, and complex threat issues. The successful candidate will demonstrate an interest in global security concerns and have experience with analysis and open-source research. RESPONSIBILITIES Complete projects as assigned, including drafting, editing, and revising location and event threat assessments Monitor for new trends and changes to security environments and alert appropriate responders Conduct open-source research for white papers and strategic projects Create maps, graphs, or other visuals to support the team’s product Assist with investigations, social media monitoring, and crisis management logistics as needed Provide 24/7 support if needed Travel to support global events as needed Communicate with co-workers, management, clients and others in a courteous and professional manner. Conform with and abide by all regulations, policies, work procedures, and instructions. REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor’s degree (business, international relations, or security-related) Experience with open-source research and report writing Excellent oral and written communication skills; ability to succinctly summarize and assess information Experience working with highly confidential information Experience completing multiple tasks simultaneously and functioning with minimal supervision Familiarity with social media monitoring and research This position requires up to 10% travel PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS 2+ years of experience working in an analytical field, including experience with geopolitics, economics, and international business Proficient in multiple languages Experience working in the Media & Entertainment Industry is a plus COMPENSATION & BENEFITS 100% Employer paid medical, dental, and vision benefits Medical selection of PPO or HDHP, including HSA employer contribution Medical FSA Dependent Care FSA Employer-paid insurance: life, STD, LTD, and AD&D 401k including employer match & immediate vesting 11 paid holidays Paid leave (vacation, sick, parental) Annual Health & Wellness Benefit Generous Fertility/Adoption benefit National Discount Employee program Employee Assistance Program for personal needs Access to Learning Management System Los Angeles, California Pay Range $70,000—$75,000 USD Concentric acknowledges the systemic barriers in the security industry and recognizes that removing those barriers will require a collaborative and conscious effort. Concentric is committed to programs and initiatives around diversity, equity, and inclusion that better our organization and our greater community. We are creating a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Concentric Advisors is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all applicants submitting personal information provided to us. You can access our GDPR and CCPA policy by clicking the GDPR button at the bottom of our career page.

title: Business Intelligence Specialist Sr
description: Are you looking for more than just a job? Do you want to have a voice and feel a sense of belonging? At ICW Group, we hire innovative people who consistently adapt, grow and deliver. We believe in hard work, a fun work environment, and embracing creativity that only comes about when talented people collaborate to develop solutions. Our mission is to create the best insurance experience possible. Headquartered in San Diego with regional offices located throughout the United States, ICW Group has been named for seven consecutive years as a Top 50 performing P&C company offering the stability of a large, profitable and growing company combined with a small-company entrepreneurial spirit. Our purpose-driven ethos provides team members with opportunities to contribute, develop, and belong. The Senior Business Intelligence Specialist will work closely with business leaders and provide quantitative and qualitative data analysis and reporting of patterns, insights, and business trends to improve outcomes.  This position will complete analysis of various complex data sources and structures in support of Business and IT teams to meet the business and financial goals of the Company. This position exists to drive solutions which require bringing together enterprise-wide data from multiple data sources, creating visualizations, and using analytics techniques to solve and support complex business problems. WHAT YOU WILL DO Collects and aggregates data from multiple internal and external sources for analyses to drive insights into business performance. Aggregates large, complex data sets from multiple databases and creates reports and dashboards. Collaborates with appropriate parties within the organization to integrate new data sources into our existing data infrastructure. Delivers complex and actionable reports that show key performance indicators, identify areas of improvement into current operations, and display root cause analysis of problems. Designs, builds, tests, and maintains reports and dashboards and identifies potential improvements to existing business intelligence, reporting and data analysis. Provides quantitative and qualitative data analysis of patterns, insights, and trends to decision-makers. Collaborates in cross-functional teams to implement analytical solutions. Ensures data quality, adherence to departmental guidelines, profitability, business impact, and other risk-related metrics for self and members of the team. Analyzes current business processes; makes recommendations to management for new, more efficient, workflows, and processes. Uses and presents analytics and metrics to improve processes and provide data-driven forecasts of potential costs, risks, and profits of new business initiatives. Validates data delivered to user community. Ensures compliance with Company data and software policies and procedures. Provides reporting solutions and responds to report requests across multiple business areas and for complex enterprise-wide projects. Collaborates with team members across the organization to identify and understand business problems and processes. Enhances and develops analytical and reporting solutions to solve business problems and extract insights. Enhances and supports enterprise-wide strategies, processes, and standards for business intelligence and reporting. Delivers complex functional specifications and system design specifications for assigned projects. Defines and develops new business intelligence capabilities that provide business with new insights for their external clients and internal operations. Engages with key stakeholders to define and adopt data analytics methodologies and standards. Serves as the subject matter expert for the department. Trains staff on project deliverables and acts as a resource for colleagues in the department to answer questions and solve complex problems. Conceptualizes and proposes reporting solutions to business leaders throughout the organization. Provide training materials, documentation, and suggestions to Enterprise Data Analytics leadership staff concerning data analysis and reporting. Ensures data quality, adherence to departmental guidelines, profitability, business impact, and other risk-related metrics for self and members of the team. Develops functional specifications and reporting design specifications for assigned projects. Uses and presents analytics and metrics to improve processes and provides data-driven forecasts of potential costs, risks, and profits of business initiatives. Mentors team members in the use of Business Intelligence tools and applications. Manages initiatives in data management, business intelligence and analytics, supporting existing and planned activities within its business unit as well as the broader organization. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES This role does not have supervisory responsibilities. WHAT YOU BRING TO THE ROLE Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Math, Economics, or Computer Science required and Minimum of 7 years of technical experience in analytics, data science, actuarial or equivalent quantitative field required. Minimum 5 years of experience with SQL, Power BI and SAP Business Objects BI required. 5+ years’ experience with Alteryx or other ETL tools preferred. Demonstrated experience with data visualization tools, such as Power BI, is required. Strong focus on delivering insights and recommendations, creating data visualizations, and building analytics capabilities to support business needs. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability and willingness to continuously acquire new knowledge (business domain knowledge, expertise with software, etc.). Effective communication, especially in a cross-functional team setting. Ability to effectively present analysis to ICW staff and external audiences. Demonstrated experience establishing trusted relationships with key internal customers is required. Ability to thrive in a fast paced and changing work environment. Training and mentoring of junior staff is required. Familiarity with business operations in the property casualty insurance industry is preferred. The current salary range for this position is $ 98,859.84 to $176,960.68 . This range is exclusive of fringe benefits and potential bonuses.  If hired at ICW Group, your final base salary compensation will be determined by factors unique to each candidate; including experience, education, and location of the role and considers employees performing substantially similar work. WHY JOIN ICW GROUP? Challenging work and the ability to make a difference You will have a voice and feel a sense of belonging We offer a competitive benefits package, with generous medical, dental, and vision plans as well as 401K retirement plans and company match Bonus potential for all positions Paid Time Off with an accrual rate of 5.23 hours per pay period (equal to 17 days per year) 10 paid holidays throughout the calendar year Want to continue learning? We’ll support you 100% ICW Group is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. ICW Group will not discriminate against an applicant or employee on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex/gender, age, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

Comfortable working independently on routine assignments. General understanding of data workflow methods and tools. Working knowledge of one or more of the following languages: SAS, R, SQL, Python. Holds certification, license, or degree as one of the following: MD, PA, Medical Technologist, RN.

title: Senior Revenue Analyst, Global Initiatives
description: Company Description LinkedIn is the world’s largest professional network, built to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Our products help people make powerful connections, discover exciting opportunities, build necessary skills, and gain valuable insights every day. We’re also committed to providing transformational opportunities for our own employees by investing in their growth. We aspire to create a culture that’s built on trust, care, inclusion, and fun – where everyone can succeed. Join us to transform the way the world works. Job Description This role will be based in Mountain View. At LinkedIn, we trust each other to do our best work where it works best for us and our teams. This role offers a hybrid work option, meaning you can both work from home and commute to a LinkedIn office, depending on what’s best for you and when it is important for your team to be together. The LinkedIn Global Revenue team’s charter is to enable the business to achieve more, enabling revenue growth with scalable, compliant solutions. Committed to pushing the boundaries of what's possible, we are seeking a Senior Revenue Analyst to join our Revenue Global Initiatives team. This role will report to the Director, Revenue, Global Initiatives and be instrumental in collaborating across different teams to drive our key revenue processes that align with our long-term vision. A successful candidate will have excellent communication and collaboration skills, a growth mindset, and a positive attitude. Having the ability to adapt to change and shift priorities quickly while maintaining accuracy will be key for this role.  While focusing on details, this candidate can consider the big picture and make recommendations for compliant processes that support LinkedIn’s future growth. Like every LinkedIn employee you will be measured on leadership, leverage and results: Leadership – The ability to inspire others around you Leverage – Do more with less/impact process that can scale with growth Results – Be accountable for producing results above what is expected Responsibilities: Execute Revenue Rhythm of Business (ROB) via insightful analytics and clear communication. Facilitate our different Scorecard processes, ensuring we have the right metrics in place and in the right forums to assess the health and progress of our business. Work cross functionally with our central compliance teams to regularly evaluate the design and operating effectiveness of internal controls, and recommend improvements as needed. Participate in cross-team initiatives focused on operational workflow improvements and efficiencies by incorporating business partner and team feedback and industry best practices. Perform accounting close duties, including financial systems user access reviews, journal entry threshold reviews, and SOX documentation. Identify and leverage technology to automate and innovate internal processes. Complete ad hoc analysis and reporting as needed. Qualifications Basic Qualifications: BA/BS degree in Business, Accounting, Finance or related field of study 5+ years accounting, compliance/ audit, or finance experience Preferred Qualifications: Intermediate Excel skills (e.g.,, PivotTable and VLOOKUP) Technical revenue accounting knowledge of US GAAP and specifically ASC 606 Ability to collaborate and be comfortable dealing with ambiguity, influencing across multiple complex organizations, and creating effecting partnerships; ability to make the complex simple A versatile and driven team player with the ability to build relationships while executing on deliverables Self-motivated individual with the ability to simultaneously drive numerous projects, and adapt to business process changes Suggested Skills: Acute attention to detail Strong interpersonal skills including written and verbal communication Collaboration, and problem-solving skills LinkedIn is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The pay range for this role is $98,000 to $160,000. Actual compensation packages are based on several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, depth of experience, certifications, and specific work location. This may be different in other locations due to differences in the cost of labor. title: Cyber Security Analyst II
description: Use your skills where innovative technology solutions begin. Eclaro is looking for a Cyber Security Analyst for our client in Palm Springs CA. ON-SITE POSITION Responsible for assisting the Director of Information Security and Compliance with protecting the clien’ts information systems and data from cyber-based threats. Actively develops and executes operational processes, procedures, and protocols to prevent and respond to cyberattacks from threat sources seeking to cause damage or steal sensitive information. Establish & implement security best practices & policies. Mentors Cyber Security Analyst I’s. Essential Duties and Responsibilities (other duties may be assigned) Monitor, detect, respond to and document cyber threats, events, and incidents as well as validate, assess and mature various operational processes. Review malware alerts on a daily basis and communicate to respective parties to contain and eradicate them. Escalate to I.T. management any vulnerable areas and solutions to increase security relative to open gaps or deficient processes. Support external forensic first responder capabilities if/as needed. Ensure all systems operate in accordance with all applicable Tribal regulatory controls and federal standards (PCI, GDPR, CCPA, etc.). Perform periodic audits of credentials and access requirements for all departments. Participate in vulnerability detection and associated remediation efforts. Perform and review vulnerability assessments to identify weaknesses and assess the effectiveness of existing controls. Identify and define security requirements for operating systems and applications. Analyze firewall, network, and SIEM rules to provide recommendations for security improvements. Assist with audit requests for documentation, responses, and remediation. Maintain knowledge of current and emerging vulnerabilities, malware, infiltration techniques, forensics, and threats. Work with I.T. security team to ensure endpoint security is installed and up to date on all pertinent systems. Work on emerging projects to help improve client’s security posture. Participate in the creation, enforcement, and consistent update of cybersecurity-based documentation such as policies, procedures, guidelines, incident response and disaster recovery plans. Assess and improve client’s security posture using attack simulation tools. Backup Cyber Security Analyst I as required Supervisory Responsibilities None Access to Sensitive Areas and Information As per the ACGC Access Matrix Signatory Ability None Qualifications Education and/or Experience Minimum 2 years of experience in the protection, analysis and support of a technology-based organizational support role as a Cyber Security Analyst, Security Analyst, Security Operations Analyst or a similar security-related area plus an additional 2 years of experience in an IT support related position Industry certification (such as CompTIA Security+, CySA+, or similar) is highly desired. Working knowledge of principal cybersecurity-centric technologies and applications such as firewalls, EDR, IDS/IPS, DLP, encryption, anti-malware, networking protocols, Microsoft Windows security events, and similar systems and tools. Proficiency with general system log monitoring, correlation, and threat management; SIEM event aggregation, correlation, and analysis is a plus. Knowledge of incident response, investigations, and related cybersecurity-based operational processes. Understanding of common email-based threats, including phishing and other exploitation techniques combined with the ability to rate emails as malicious/clean and take necessary steps. Experience with PC and server hardware utilizing Microsoft Operating Systems (Windows 10 and above, Windows Server 20xx), Microsoft Exchange, and Microsoft Office Suite. Experience with processing vulnerability assessments and related information and coordinating and/or conducting essential responses. Excellent verbal, written, communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, highly matrixed, and rapidly-changing environment. Ability to work after normal business hours as needed or required. Bachelor’s degree in computer science or information sciences from a four-year college or university, an equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered. Working Conditions/Physical Demands To perform this job successfully, the individual must be able to stand, move and work throughout the office area and properties, including walking up to 1 ½ miles, climbing stairs and sitting at a desk/workstation for the duration of the shift. Typically, the individual will be housed in an office environment. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate but will escalate when located in the casino environment. Must be able to grasp, bend, lift and/or carry or otherwise move goods weighing a minimum of 25 lbs. on an intermittent basis, and sufficient dexterity of hand in order to use office equipment including, but not limited to a computer keyboard, calculator, general office equipment and multi-line telephone. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. If interested, you may contact: Leafer Enriquez leafer.enriquez@eclaro.com 646-695-2941 Equal Opportunity Employer: Eclaro values diversity and does not discriminate based on Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description: Job Title: Sr. Data Engineer Location: South San Francisco CA 94080 Duration: 6 - 12 months contract Client: Genentech Job Description: This Senior Data Engineer sits in the CMG Data Management & Architecture team (DMA) within Strategic Analytics & Intelligence (SAI). This team plays a key role in data engineering, data integration and data quality, from strategy, governance and implementation across the portfolio and helps shape the data needs to enable Roche's global customer engagement vision, strategy, and solutions across our global programs. The Opportunity: The Senior Data Engineer will be responsible for the development, management, and delivery of a robust data engineering and architecture, to build Extraction, Transformation and Load (ETL) Data Pipelines, Data Integration, Data Governance (Data Quality, Data Security) for Genentech. You will shape and implement the evolving data governance model, as it relates to management and usage of data across different functions including Commercial, Medical Affairs & Govt. Affairs. As a data engineering expert, you will work closely with Data Science teams, Data Lake Architects, Product Managers, Data Strategy and Enablement leads to understand ETL/Data Integration and Engineering requirements, design, test and implement appropriate data engineering solutions. The Senior Data Engineer will forge strong relationships with stakeholders & partners to lead, inform, gain alignment, unlock & resolve complex business challenges, continuously evaluate cutting edge data engineering solutions, influence the future roadmap and drive end-end implementation. You will define, build test and implement Data Engineering – ETL, Data Integrations, Data Governance, Data Quality, for CMG (Commercial, Medical Affairs, Access Solutions and Government Affairs) The Senior Data Engineer will lead, consult and participate in CMG work products to drive Data Engineering Solutions You will establish industry standard and best practices for Data Engineering You will build reusable Data Engineering assets and frameworks Who You Are: You have a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field. 7+ years of work experience including hands-on technical experience with SQL, Python, PySpark, Jupyter Notebook, database design, and ETL processes. The ideal candidate will have proven experience on building modern data pipelines - Ingestion, Profiling, Integration, Summarization / Aggregation, Logging, Orchestrations, DAG etc. You're experience building Data Quality frameworks / solutions, Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) is strong You have proven hands-on experience with cloud-based data warehousing / data lake platforms such as AWS S3, Athena, Glue, AWS Wrangler, Sagemaker Studio, GitRepo, CloudWatch, Lambda You have experience with data modeling, architecture and database schema design You have experience handling semi-structured (JSON, Key Value Pair) and unstructured data formats (Free text, documents etc.).

title: Senior Analyst, Financial Data Governance
description: Employee Applicant Privacy Notice Who we are: Shape a brighter financial future with us. Together with our members, we’re changing the way people think about and interact with personal finance. We’re a next-generation financial services company and national bank using innovative, mobile-first technology to help our millions of members reach their goals. The industry is going through an unprecedented transformation, and we’re at the forefront. We’re proud to come to work every day knowing that what we do has a direct impact on people’s lives, with our core values guiding us every step of the way. Join us to invest in yourself, your career, and the financial world. The role: This role will be an extension of the Accounting and Controllership function and will partner with data producers, owners and consumers to apply the power of data & analytics to deliver new insights and data-driven solutions to accelerate business outcomes. This role will report to the Lead, Financial Data Governance. In this role you will utilize your Data Governance and Accounting skills to assist the Controllership function to consume and deliver trusted data to the organization in line with ongoing evolution in company strategy; ensuring stability, quality and meeting the needs to power the organization. This role will enable the use of data for ensuring the integrity of our financial reporting and accounting, as well as strengthen strategic decision-making by understanding and addressing the data and analytics needs of stakeholders. The role will understand and analyze the Finance & Accounting data assets to help provide high-quality data that is easily accessible in a consistent manner. Be responsible for customer, supplier, and product master data-related activities to ensure our data is complete, accurate, and follows data governance policies. This role will be responsible for creating/updating data flows, capturing metadata, creating data lineage and analyzing/improving data quality across multiple data domains. This role will help ensure adherence to data governance guidelines for data assets and associated analytics within Finance & Accounting processes, resulting in enhanced data and analytics accuracy, better data timeliness, and improved protection of sensitive data. What you’ll do: Key Responsibilities of this role Data Governance: Ensure compliance with Enterprise Data Governance Policies and Standards as it relates to data production, aggregation and consumption of data. Assist with operationalization of data governance processes in partnership with data owners Contribute effectively to the execution of the Enterprise Data Strategy, Critical Data Element (CDE) management and related efforts. Partner with data producers and IT Group to implement data standards, business rules and Data Quality (“DQ”) issues and escalation procedures. Facilitate and support education and ongoing training in Enterprise data governance policies and procedures. Metadata Management: Work with functional units to identify CDE, business terms, lineage mapping and socialize progress among stakeholders. Work with Business Process Owners and the Data Governance User Group(s) to identify, classify and define each assigned CDE and ensure that each element has a clear and unambiguous definition. Document and maintain CDE business descriptions, data lineage, data sources, transformation logic in a centralized data governance repository. Data Quality Management: Facilitate and support data quality improvement initiatives across DQ dimensions Collaborate with Data Owners, Business Process owners and IT data to ensure data used for risk, financial, regulatory, operational and management reporting is fit for purpose. Based on changes in the business work environment, job responsibilities can change, and additional functions and tasks may be added or removed accordingly. Additionally, this position will perform other duties as required, and participate in special projects as deemed necessary and appropriate by Management. What you’ll need: Education: Bachelor's Degree. Experience: 5+ years of relevant work experience. Previous experience in building a similar function within Accounting and Finance. Relevant experience in the financial services industry. Experience working with data owners, data stewards, and business leaders to ensure data is connected, clean, and sufficiently complete to enable business decisions, drive business growth, optimize costs, and reduce risk exposure. Requires business acumen, strategic thinking, financial analytical skills and decision-making skills. Experience working in an Enterprise Data Governance Program is strongly preferred, as well as a sound understanding of data governance practices, metadata management, data quality concepts and familiarity with regulatory requirements in the financial services industry. Knowledge of CDE identification, data attributes and lineage documentation. Experience with architecture design, relational databases and process design is a plus. Knowledge of data governance, data quality practices and relevant tools such as tools such as Alation, Collibra, JIRA, Monte Carlo, Great expectations or similar tools. Strategic and independent thinker with Hands-on approach to achieving data governance goals and a collaborative working style with the ability to work with line of business partners to build consensus. Effective communicator with ability to build alliances with stakeholders across the Company Strong communication skills both verbal and writing, with attention to detail. Ability to multi-task and a fast learner. Must be versatile, able to work effectively independently or as part of a team on multiple projects simultaneously. Nice to have: Big 4 experience is preferred Prefer FinTech, banking and/or financial services experience Compensation And Benefits The base pay range for this role is listed below. Final base pay offer will be determined based on individual factors such as the candidate’s experience, skills, and location. To view all of our comprehensive and competitive benefits, visit our Benefits at SoFi page! SoFi provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion (including religious dress and grooming practices), sex (including pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, breastfeeding, and conditions related to breastfeeding), gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, age (40 or over), physical or medical disability, medical condition, marital status, registered domestic partner status, sexual orientation, genetic information, military and/or veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by applicable state or federal law. The Company hires the best qualified candidate for the job, without regard to protected characteristics. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. New York applicants: Notice of Employee Rights SoFi is committed to embracing diversity. As part of this commitment, SoFi offers reasonable accommodations to candidates with physical or mental disabilities. If you need accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, please let your recruiter know or email accommodations@sofi.com. Due to insurance coverage issues, we are unable to accommodate remote work from Hawaii or Alaska at this time. Internal Employees If you are a current employee, do not apply here - please navigate to our Internal Job Board in Greenhouse to apply to our open roles.

title: Product Master Data (PMD) Analyst
description: This position is responsible for maintaining the product item master data across multiple databases and systems. Part of this responsibility includes coordinating with international planning and market level data managers ensuring data structure adheres to proper master data hierarchy. This is an ongoing continuous improvement effort as current architecture is not fully aligned. They will work closely with Product Creation, Engineering and Planning teams to ensure system data is in place to support new product forecasting, Purchasing, assembly and financial activity. This individual will also work with IT and other functions to help manage system end user testing as well as proposing and driving continuous process improvements relative to Product Master Data (PMD) across the company. Essential Functions And Key Responsibilities Master Data Serve as the primary gatekeeper for Product Master Data (PMD) for SKUs; including setting up and maintaining part numbers, as well as ensuring that item master information is accurate and consistent across the globe. Help standardize the process of creating new SKUs and ensuring teams across the globe comply. Validation of SKUs’ Product Master data between TaylorMade’s in-house PLM application and Oracle. Maintain US Transfer Price lists in Oracle for intercompany shipments within TaylorMade to help regions clear customs on time. Responsible for the coordination of new product and program launch requirements for product master data: identify, develop, define, and document all milestones and deliverables globally. Collaborate closely with Product Development, Engineering and Operations to ensure Master Data readiness: update Oracle with SKU master data, BOMs and costing information under tight deadlines. High accuracy level required as this drives GTM and cost management success. Manage timing and communications related to publishing official product names in Oracle; with Purchasing Team as it relates to vendor launch activities; with WMS Team for updates to Warehouse Management System (WMS) platforms; and Configurator Team for configurator launch activities. Manage and help troubleshoot the Global Inventory Standard Costing Process in conjunction with Global Finance. Effectively drive product FOB cost deadlines with Product Costing teams and Finance. Coordinate annual re-cost activities for carryover products with global regions, Finance and IT. Manage the loading of Product FOB SKU costs into Oracle for inventory standard creation and auditing of information populated in systems for NAM inventory orgs. Maintenance of BOMs and routings in US inventory orgs in support of planning and assembly activities. Identify, test, and implement PMD enhancements to PLM application forms to align with future roadmap of TM master data and business initiatives. Engage the business to better leverage product master data for enhanced reporting and system functionality. Work cross-functionally with Product Creation, Engineering, Finance, Sales, and Supply Chain to maintain key item attributes required for reporting metrics. Maintain DOMO KPI Dashboard metrics and create presentation materials to highlight KPIs and recent achievements/milestones. Operations Communicate and help enforce HQ Operational policies as it pertains to global and regional product launch activities. Facilitate SKU/BOM creation of last-minute Sales programs, SMU’s and expedite requests. Management of mini projects that enhance products/services provided to customers both internally and externally. Harmonizing and standardizing KPI Reporting and other business metrics using the DOMO reporting tool. Coordinates Project Level activity with Commercial and Operations in support of sales programs by ensuring ad hoc data set ups are in place under critical path deadlines. Maintain a calendar of future launches, communicating and educating launch process out to the operational stakeholders. Participate in Go-to-Launch meetings and provide status updates on PMD deliverables and identify when upstream deliverables are not being met and impacting ability for us to meet our deadlines. Perform other related duties and assignments as required. Knowledge And Skills Requirements Excellent analytical skills: ability to look at numbers and draw conclusions about actions to be taken Experience working within a product launch process and collaborating with cross-functional teams (Sales, Planning, Costing, Finance, Purchasing, etc) Experience with relational databases (e.g. MS Access, Business Objects, etc) Critical attention to detail; ability to analyze information for consistency and accuracy Demonstrated ability to meet absolute deadlines Proven ability to work in a team-oriented, collaborative environment. Proficient in Microsoft Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint). Strong English written and verbal communication skills and ability to interact with all levels. Education, Work Experience, And Professional Certifications BS Degree in relevant field preferred, or related work experience. 3-5 years of related work experience in high-throughput supply chain environment (>10 million annual units) Work Environment / Physical Requirements Normal office conditions with extensive computer and phone usage. Ability to work extended hours as necessary. Able to work efficiently and accurately in an atmosphere of frequent interruption. Light physical effort equal to frequent lifting or moving of lightweight materials. Occasional travel may be required. TaylorMade is a performance driven organization and our total rewards approach to compensation is designed to support this. We consider many factors in determining base compensation, including position scope, job related knowledge, education, skills, experience, and work location. The expected annual salary for this position is $69,000 - $78,000. Additional benefits, such as health & wellness, performance bonuses, product discounts, holidays, paid time off, etc. may also be offered in accordance with our plans. TaylorMade Golf Company is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religious creed, color, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, pregnancy, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, sexual orientation, military and veteran status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance, or regulation.

title: Data Engineer for Marketing
description: Job Summary This company is looking for a Marketing Data Engineer to join our team. This contract role will offer the right candidate first-hand experience in a booming industry. A successful candidate will be responsible for streamlining reporting and data aggregation with GA4 and other 3rd party marketing tools. You'll lead and assist in building visualizations, dashboards, running SQL queries, and creating and managing tags in Google Tag Manager. location: SANTA CLARA, California job type: Contract salary: $55 - 80 per hour work hours: 8am to 4pm education: High School Responsibilities Responsibilities: Aggregate traffic and revenue data accurately in GA4 from the following sources: Google Ads, Microsoft Ads, Meta, Reddit and additional online paid/organic sources. Fix any data discrepancies due to Google Tag Manager Audit Google Tag Manager's triggers and tags for accuracy and it's data feed to other platforms Work with the team to QA tags and data streams for accuracy Work with Engineering and Marketing teams to align on tracking KPIs Qualifications Experience level: Experienced Minimum 3 years of experience Education: High School Skills Python (1 year of experience is required) Tableau (3 years of experience is required) SQL (1 year of experience is required) Google Tag Manager (3 years of experience is required) Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status. At Randstad Digital, we welcome people of all abilities and want to ensure that our hiring and interview process meets the needs of all applicants. If you require a reasonable accommodation to make your application or interview experience a great one, please contact HRsupport@randstadusa.com. Pay offered to a successful candidate will be based on several factors including the candidate's education, work experience, work location, specific job duties, certifications, etc. In addition, Randstad Digital offers a comprehensive benefits package, including health, an incentive and recognition program, and 401K contribution (all benefits are based on eligibility). This posting is open for thirty (30) days. Qualified applicants in San Francisco with criminal histories will be considered for employment in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.
