title: Data Reporting and Analytics Consultant III, Biostatistics
description: The programmer will support primarily National Institute of Mental Health-funded observational and industry studies. One of the main funded projects aims to predict which patients with depression will respond to antidepressants. Tasks may range from cohort identification, data transformation and extraction from clinical records databases, implementing or working with survey or other data collection from study participants, data cleaning and assembly, data analysis, interpretation of results, and database creation, engaging in collaborations with other institutions that may include data harmonization and joint analyses, development or implementation of study tracking systems and data repositories and generating progress reports, and supporting development of grants, abstracts, presentations, and publications. Data analysis will include clinical predictive modeling for application in health systems. Other tasks may include patient identification for prospective implementation and clinical trial work, integration of genomic data from the KP Research Bank and Research Program on Genes, Environment, and Health. The analyst is expected to work closely with the investigators, project managers, data analysts, and other team members. Opportunities to engage in or lead manuscript authorship are welcome. Essential Responsibilities Pursues self-development and effective relationships with others by proactively providing resources, information, advice, and expertise with coworkers and customers; influencing others through technical explanations and examples; providing occasional mentoring to team members; listening and responding to, seeking, and addressing performance feedback; creating plans to capitalize on strengths and develop weaknesses; anticipating and responding to the needs of others; and adapting to and learning from change, difficulties, and feedback. Completes work assignments by applying up-to-date expertise in subject area to generate creative solutions; ensuring all procedures and policies are followed; leveraging an understanding of data, and resources to support projects or initiatives; collaborating cross-functionally to solve business problems; identifying and monitoring priorities, deadlines, and expectations; communicating progress and information; identifying, recommending, and implementing ways to address improvement opportunities; and escalating issues or risks as appropriate. Supports and develops analytical and/or statistical models enabling informed business decisions by determining data and analytical requirements; creating models leading to actionable insights; and testing, refining, and validating models. Gathers data and information on targeted variables in an established systematic fashion by validating data sources; querying, merging, and extracting data across sources; completing routine data refresh and update; developing and/or delivering tools for electronic data collection; and providing user training, support, and documentation. Supports data analysis interpretation by applying findings to contextual settings under the guidance of more senior employees; and developing reports and presentations telling a compelling story to stakeholders to enable and influence decision making. Develops, implements, and automates business and reporting solutions by working with stakeholders in their design, planning, and implementation while ensuring consistency and coherency; summarizing data and results; creating summary statistics; organizing data reports, visualizations, and/or interactive Business Intelligence (BI) reports; identifying needs for the development and implementation of additional reporting solutions; and preparing documentation as appropriate. Prepares data for analytic efforts by consolidating data; reviewing data for quality and accuracy; profiling data inaccuracies; and cleaning and creating final data set(s) for analysis. Supports data-informed decisions by consulting with clients to identify and clarify key business needs; developing outcomes and process measures; translating business requirements; determining data/information needs and data collection methods; developing analysis plans; measuring the impact of business decisions on clients, customers, and/or members; working with clients and staff to identify opportunities and methods to improve efficiencies with analysis; supporting and training end-users; and documenting processes and deliverables. Supports the execution of creative data analytic approaches leading to actionable outcomes by identifying metrics to be analyzed; calculating algorithms; and conducting analyses under the guidance of more senior employees, including descriptive, correlational, inferential, and/or predictive statistics. Minimum Qualifications Minimum one (1) year statistical modeling experience using SAS, R, or another advanced statistical package. Masters degree in Biostatistics, Statistics, Public Health, Data Science, or related field and Minimum three (3) years experience in data analytics or a directly related field. Additional equivalent work experience in a directly related field may be substituted for the degree requirement. Additional Requirements Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities (KSAs): Data Quality; Model Creation and Interpretation; Procedure Manuals and Documentation; Health Care Coding; Process Mapping; Program Writing; Internal or External Publication; Written Communication; Data Extraction; Data Mining; Data Visualization Tools; Statistical Programming Language; Relational Database Management; Project Management; Business Planning

title: System Engineer, Customer Data Platform
description: The Enterprise Technology team supports insights with data and the technical systems that give our teams leverage to achieve their objectives. We work cross-functionally with Asana’s business teams to understand their goals and ensure they receive the data and technical support they need to flourish. We are looking for a seasoned System Engineer to join our dynamic Marketing Technology team within Asana’s Enterprise Technology organization. This role will play a critical part in optimizing and managing our Customer Data Platform (CDP) and other Marketing Technology (Martech) tools. You will be responsible for integrating, configuring, and maintaining our Martech infrastructure to drive data-driven marketing initiatives and enhance customer experiences across multiple channels. This role is based in our San Francisco office with an office-centric hybrid schedule. The standard in-office days are Monday, Tuesday, and Thursday. Most Asanas have the option to work from home on Wednesdays. Working from home on Fridays depends on the type of work you do and the teams with which you partner. If you're interviewing for this role, your recruiter will share more about the in-office requirements. What You’ll Achieve Segment CDP Management: Maintain, optimize, and manage our Segment CDP. Ensure accurate and efficient data collection, transformation, and distribution through Segment. Develop custom integrations using node.js, SQL, etc. Implement and test real-time inbound and outbound integrations Monitor data flow, identify anomalies, and ensure data quality and consistency. Collaborate with business, product, and data teams to ensure data needs are met. Content Management System (CMS) Integration and Management: Integrate and customize CMS to support marketing campaigns. Work with web developers and content creators to ensure seamless publishing processes. Maintain and optimize CMS functionalities to align with marketing strategies. Personalization and Experimentation Tools: Implement and manage web personalization tools to deliver tailored experiences to customers. Use data-driven insights to create and optimize personalization strategies. Monitor and assess website performance and user engagement through A/B testing and other methodologies. Utilize technology,including AI, for the customization of content and graphics. Localization Tools: Implement and manage localization tools to ensure content is accurately translated and culturally relevant. Coordinate with regional teams to support multi-language and multi-regional marketing initiatives. Monitor localized content for quality and consistency. Collaboration and Stakeholder Management: Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams including marketing, product, IT, and analytics. Serve as a Martech subject matter expert, providing guidance and support to internal stakeholders. Communicate technical details and benefits effectively to non-technical team members. About You Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Marketing, or a related field. Extensive experience (6+ years) in marketing technology with a strong focus on CDPs, preferably Segment and marketing automation and CRM tools like Marketo, Iterable, Salesforce. Certifications in Segment, CMS platforms, or relevant Martech tools preferred. Familiarity with customer journey mapping and analytics tools like Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, or Mixpanel. Proficiency in programming or scripting languages including SQL, and JavaScript or Python, with a strong understanding of data governance principles and best practices. Experience with CMS platforms like Contentful and localization tools for multi-language content management. Experience with web personalization tools like Optimizely, Adobe Target, or similar, and AI capabilities for content/graphic personalization tools. Strong problem-solving skills and keen attention to detail. Effective communication and collaboration skills in a fast-paced environment. At Asana, we're committed to building teams that include a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills, as this is critical to helping us achieve our mission. If you're interested in this role and don't meet every listed requirement, we still encourage you to apply. What We’ll Offer Our comprehensive compensation package plays a big part in how we recognize you for the impact you have on our path to achieving our mission. We believe that compensation should be reflective of the value you create relative to the market value of your role. To ensure pay is fair and not impacted by biases, we're committed to looking at market value which is why we check ourselves and conduct a yearly pay equity audit. For this role, the estimated base salary range is between $173,000 - $221,000. The actual base salary will vary based on various factors, including market and individual qualifications objectively assessed during the interview process. The listed range above is a guideline, and the base salary range for this role may be modified. In addition to base salary, your compensation package may include additional components such as equity, sales incentive pay (for most sales roles), and benefits. If you're interviewing for this role, speak with your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about the total compensation and benefits for this role. We strive to provide equitable and competitive benefits packages that support our employees worldwide and include: Mental health, wellness & fitness benefits Career coaching & support Inclusive family building benefits Long-term savings or retirement plans In-office culinary options to cater to your dietary preferences These are just some of the benefits we offer, and benefits may vary based on role, country, and local regulations. If you're interviewing for this role, speak with your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about the total compensation and benefits for this role. About Us Asana helps teams orchestrate their work, from small projects to strategic initiatives. Millions of teams around the world rely on Asana to achieve their most important goals, faster. Asana has been named a Top 10 Best Workplace for 5 years in a row, is Fortune's #1 Best Workplace in the Bay Area, and one of Glassdoor’s and Inc.’s Best Places to Work. After spending more than a year physically distanced, Team Asana is safely and mindfully returning to in-person collaboration, incorporating flexibility that adds hybrid elements to our office-centric culture . With 11+ offices all over the world, we are always looking for individuals who care about building technology that drives positive change in the world and a culture where everyone feels that they belong. We believe in supporting people to do their best work and thrive, and building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive company is core to our mission. Our goal is to ensure that Asana upholds an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued, whether they are applying for an open position or working at the company. title: Jr Statistician - Urology
description: Description It takes more than highly-specialized knowledge and insight to bring breakthrough discoveries to life. It requires a true passion for uncovering the unknown. At UCLA Health, that’s what our researchers bring to their critical work every day. Join the Department of Urology as a full time Jr. Statistician and make a vital contribution to our incredible achievements. title: Intelligence Analyst Senior
description: Location Barksdale AFB, LA Clearance Active TS/SCI Provide the Standoff Munitions Application Center (SMAC) support to the Joint Forces Air Component Commander (JFACC) by optimizing the efficiency and combat effectiveness of Low-Density/High-Demand (LD/HD) global strike and theater standoff munitions. Coordinate with all echelons of DoD and the Intelligence Community to develop organizational relationships, facilitate research, gather mission planning data and create assessment supporting collection plans. Successful completion of a service intelligence course. At least twelve (12) years of relevant experience working with and analyzing COMINT, MASINT, IMINT and SIGINT, and demonstrated relevant experience supporting military tactical aircraft mission planning. Demonstrated relevant experience assessing and analyzing actual and potential adversary Command and Control (C2) capabilities and systems. Demonstrated operational knowledge of the various J2 Command entities involved in overall planning and execution of joint operations and evaluations. Demonstrated experience with and operational knowledge of training and instructional methods utilized to teach intelligence support to mission planning. Demonstrated experience with and operational knowledge of joint and service Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR) capabilities. Experience with and operational knowledge of Joint Targeting process, the integration into mission planning and associated target product maintenance. Preferred Prefer operational experience in Joint Staff, Air Staff, MAJCOM, or Numbered Air Force (NAF) Staff. company: California Department of Health Care Services
title: Data Project Support Analyst (Hybrid Option)
description: Job Description And Duties Why Join DHCS? The Department of Health Care Services (DHCS) is the backbone of California’s health care safety net. Our success is made possible by the hard work of more than 4,800 DHCS team members and through collaboration with the federal government and other state agencies, counties, and partners for the care of low-income families, children, pregnant women, older adults, and persons with disabilities. This is an exciting opportunity to join our diverse team in the following role. If you are interested in joining our team, apply today! About this Role: As a subject matter generalist, the Associate Governmental Program Analyst (AGPA) performs the more responsible, varied, and complex assignments such as program evaluation and planning; policy analysis and formulation; systems development; budgeting, planning, management, and personnel analysis, and provides consultative services to management or others as needed. Specifically, the AGPA will conduct research, data analysis, technical assistance, and support the needs of the various projects assigned to the Data Support Unit. The AGPA is a member of the Data Governance Branch-Data Support Unit, whose function is to assist the other branches within Enterprise Data and Information Management (EDIM) on a multitude of projects and is under the direction of the Unit Chief. The Department will provide reasonable accommodations to meet these requirements. Training and Development (T&D) assignments may be considered for this position for current California civil service employees. T&D assignments cannot exceed 24 months. However, successful T&D candidates may transition to a permanent appointment, if eligible at the end of the T&D assignment. This recruitment has been posted for more vacancies than currently exist as it may be used to fill additional identical vacancies which occur within 180 days of the closing date of this bulletin. Telework – refers to all working days at approved alternate work location. Minimum Requirements You will find the Minimum Requirements in the Class Specification. ASSOCIATE GOVERNMENTAL PROGRAM ANALYST STAFF SERVICES ANALYST Additional Documents Job Application Package Checklist Duty Statement Position Details Job Code #: JC-438729 Position #(s): 803-396-5393-725 Working Title: Data Project Support Analyst (Hybrid Option) Classification: ASSOCIATE GOVERNMENTAL PROGRAM ANALYST $5,684.00 - $7,114.00 A Shall Consider: STAFF SERVICES ANALYST $3,640.00 - $4,561.00 A $3,941.00 - $4,933.00 B $4,726.00 - $5,916.00 C # of Positions: Multiple Work Location: Sacramento County Telework: Hybrid Job Type: Permanent, Full Time Department Information DHCS is California’s health care safety net, helping millions of low-income and disabled Californians each and every day. DHCS' purpose is to provide equitable access to quality health care leading to a healthy California for all. DHCS is a dynamic department with ambitious goals and talented, committed employees. We work hard every day to fulfill our vital responsibility to support the delivery of quality health care to Californians. DHCS is committed to addressing disparities with our organization and in our communities through efforts toward greater diversity, equity, and inclusion. This is accomplished, in part, by a commitment toward employing a diverse workforce which reflects the many communities we serve, and by promoting and enforcing equal employment opportunities. Take a look at some of DHCS' recent projects and happenings that our Department has accomplished in the DHCS Newsroom . The Data Analytics Division’s (DAD) mission is to describe and analyze data to answer questions that can be used to meet business objectives and drive decision making. The DAD is part of the EDIM program, which provides department-wide leadership and support of the collection, analysis, management, and dissemination of quality data and data products in order for programs to make sound, data-driven decisions to better serve beneficiaries, improve outcomes, and support programmatic needs and requirements. All hires subject to HR approval. title: System Engineer
description: Title: Systems Engineer 1 Location: Santa Clara, CA 95050 -- Onsite Duration: 12+ Months contract role Pay Rate: $40.00 - $48.00/Hour on W2. Job description: REIMBURSEMENT SPECIALIST: System Engineer - Hardware Support Overview: Roche Sequencing Solutions & Roche Molecular Lab (Santa Clara) are developing nanopore based sequencing dedicated to making clinical genetic testing easy and affordable. We are developing a revolutionary single-molecule DNA sequencer that can improve the lives of people in a wide variety of ways including timely screening for diseases and diagnosis of various cancers. Roche is looking for a motivated and team-oriented individual who is passionate about next generation sequencing technology. The System Engineer’s focus is on improving reliability and robustness of the sequencing and sample prep platforms through failure analysis, root cause investigations, troubleshooting and identifying and supporting implementation of solutions. The candidate will be a technical contributor on complex and novel projects that require ingenuity, creativity, and technical expertise. The candidate is someone who does not shy away from a difficult problem but seeks it out. Drawing on experience in systems, biochemistry, electrochemistry, electromechanical and/or materials science, the System Engineer will be part of the troubleshooting team and will be responsible for supporting the next generation sequencing system and the sample prep platform. This support role will require the candidate to be able to work in a fast-paced environment typically supporting more than one issue at a time. The candidate must be self-motivated, details-oriented, and able to work well in a team. Responsibilities: Become an expert on the operation and functionality of the Roche Sequencing Platform and Sample Prep platform to ensure minimal system down time. Work with the engineering teams on resolving discovered issues and propose solutions to common failure modes. Support the lab teams with system troubleshooting both at the hardware/software level and the assay level. Execute experiments and testing protocols to ensure platform functionality. Clearly and timely communicate and collaborate across system, device, instrument, and reagent teams in root cause investigation findings and solution implementations. Help design, troubleshoot, and perform instrument development in a fast- paced environment. Good understanding of statistical methods. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Who are you: You’re someone who wants to influence your own development. You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and disciplines. Where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point. B.S. with 2-3+ years of experience or M.S with 1+ in a Bioengineering, mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, computer engineering, mechatronics, or a related disciple. Troubleshooting experience in development or operations of microfluidics, liquid handler, diagnostic systems, NGS systems. Experience in failure analysis and/or defect management is a plus. Understanding of sequencing methodologies Ability to perform statistical analysis of data with programs such as JMP, R, etc. Familiarity with computer programming in languages such as Python is a plus. Meticulous attention to detail and excellent written and electronic record keeping skills. Strong oral and written communication skills Self-motivated and able to work well in a team. Willing to work in a lab setting. Pay Rate & Benefits: This is the pay range that Magnit reasonably expects to pay for this position: $40.00/hour-$48.00/hour on W2. QUALIFICATION/ LICENSURE : Work Authorization : Green Card, US Citizen Preferred years of experience : 3+ Years Travel Required : No travel required. Shift timings: 9 AM to 5 PM

title: Unix Engineer
description: This role requires an ACTIVE TOP SECRET CLEARANCE ✔ In this role you will assist with data center design, deployment, and documentation and will need domain knowledge of the existing areas✔ Northrop Grumman Aeronautics Systems has an opening for a Unix Engineer to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals in San Diego, California, where we define possible. Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics) discipline from an accredited university and 2 years of STEM related engineering experience Experience in scripting/programming languages such as Python, Bash, and Powershell Experience deploying, configuring, and hardening virtual machines Infrastructure automation experience with tools such as Ansible, Packer, Terraform, etc Experience deploying in virtualized environments (VMWare and Hyper-V) Basic infrastructure knowledge in Backup/Storage and Network technologies Active DoD Top Secret clearance Ability to obtain (and maintain) special program access (PAR). Preferred Qualifications: Familiar with Agile methodology Familiar with version control, GIT experience preferred Experience with Cloud Platforms such as AWS and Azure Ability to author and maintain technical installation, configuration, and update documentation Excellent communication, interpersonal skills, and the ability to interface with all levels of employees and management Essential Functions: Ability to assist in of automating manual datacenter processes using Automation tools (Ansible, python, bash, etc.). Assist in development of CI/CD processes. Develop engineering and automated deployments for datacenter system configurations. Executing engineering projects on schedule. Collaborate with engineers to troubleshoot and redline documented procedures. Implement engineering changes to the system as required Responsible for integrating and testing software and/or hardware systems in complex IT systems. Work closely with Engineers and Technicians in a lab environment. Good planning, coordination, and documentation skills are required.

title: SAP Master Data Analyst
description: Company Description At Lakeshore, we create innovative learning materials and world-class guest experiences for teachers, parents and children. Since 1954, we’ve grown into a global community—with a thriving e-commerce business, multiple catalogs, 60+ retail stores, a peerless national sales force, plus international offices that support our preeminent supply chain division. But today we’re working better, smarter and faster than ever—and setting our sights even higher. We’re building an infrastructure designed for scalability, embracing data-driven decision-making and using technology to improve efficiency and ensure the best tools for the best work. Most importantly, we continue to invest in a diverse team of inquisitive top talent who fuel each other’s passions and curiosity, take risks, try new things, and believe that every new day brings opportunities for growth Job Description We are seeking a SAP Master Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for the creation, validation, and maintenance of SAP data records. You will ensure the precision and integrity of organizational data, diligently adhering to established data governance rules. You will actively engage in building comprehensive documentation to streamline and enhance the workflow processes within the Master Data team. You will support the team's mission to maintain data accuracy, uphold data standards and foster continuous improvement within master data management (MDM) practices. A day in the office looks like this: Providing guidance on MDM reporting and data extraction needs, including reviewing GUI table access. Building and maintaining processes and workflows to facilitate efficient data reporting Providing knowledge of Fiori and GUI tables for creating and implementing changes related to all MDM activities Maintaining Request Templates and create comprehensive documentation for all relevant MDM Fiori Tiles, ensuring consistency and accessibility Documenting all MDM scenarios and establish RACI (Responsible, Accountable, Consulted, Informed) matrices to clarify roles and responsibilities Monitoring project statuses and effectively communicate ticket statuses to stakeholders Continuously evaluating and improving MDM processes, streamlining workflows and enhancing efficiency Got the skills and experience? Here’s what we’re looking for: 2 years of experience in SAP MDM SAP Winshuttle experience a plus SAP expertise: knowledge of SAP modules and functions relevant to master data management, Data integration: experience in integrating master data across different systems, ensuring consistency and accuracy through data mapping, transformation and validation processes Data quality management: Experience in establishing data quality standards, monitoring data quality and implementing data cleansing processes Data governance: Understanding of data governance principles, policies and practices to Documentation: Proficiency in documenting data processes, workflows, data dictionaries and standard operating procedures Problem-solving: Aptitude for identifying complex data issues and developing effective solutions, often in collaboration with cross-functional teams Attention to detail: Strong focus on accuracy and precision when managing critical data elements Communication: Skilled at conveying technical information clearly to both technical and nontechnical stakeholders, and actively listening to gather requirements and address concerns Collaboration: Ability to work seamlessly with various teams, departments and stakeholders to achieve common data-related objectives Change management: Skilled at planning, organizing and executing data management projects within specified timelines and budgets And here’s our end of the bargain! Salary: $70,000-$80,000 with an annual bonus of up to 10% Paid leave for new parents to support work/life balance and family bonding Excellent medical/dental and vision coverage—EPO, PPO and HSA 401(k) retirement plan with company contribution (because you will retire someday) Flexible benefits—choose what you like, ignore the rest On-site preschool for our employees’ children On-site employee gym for all levels/fitness needs Generous employee discount on products that make you smarter Casual dress…and we really mean it At Lakeshore, we know our diversity makes us stronger, and when everyone feels included and valued, we all win. We strive to embrace our differences and create an intentionally diverse and inclusive community that is representative of the teachers, families and children we serve. We know we couldn’t do the extraordinary things we’re doing without the people on our team. Thanks to the passion and enthusiasm of this spectacular group, Lakeshore is more than a great place to work—it’s a great experience to be part of. Day in and day out, we give everything we’ve got to create products that instill a sense of wonder and foster a true love of learning. To help maintain this high bar for success, we’re constantly on the lookout for people to join us. So if you’re a down-to-earth professional who shares our desire for making a difference, we’d love to hear from you. To learn more about Lakeshore, visit www.lakeshorelearning.com/careers Equal Employment Opportunity Policy People are selected to become members of the Lakeshore family based on skill, merit and mind-boggling talent—not based on race, color, creed, sexual orientation, gender or gender identity, marital status, domestic partnership status, military status, religion, age, national origin, ancestry, alienage, AIDS or AIDS-related complex status, genetic information, predisposition or carrier status, status as a victim of domestic violence, physical or mental disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. If things aren’t equal, we all lose.

title: Sr Analyst, Franchise Insights
description: Are you curious, creative, and love data? Do you enjoy collaborating with colleagues and using data to drive actionable insights? If the answer is yes, this Senior Analyst opportunity may be the role for you! The Franchise Insights team leads efforts in understanding consumer sentiment, behavior, and preferences when engaging with entertainment franchises. Using data and insights, the team plays an integral part in key business decisions and helps maximize the potential of The Walt Disney Company brands and franchises globally. Reporting to the Senior Manager, Franchise Insights, the Senior Analyst is responsible for helping shape insights and communicating strategic recommendations to executive leadership on business driving topics. As the key analytic resource on a wide variety of high-profile projects, the Senior Analyst prepares data that drives decision-making at the highest levels of The Walt Disney Company. The Franchise Insights team dual reports into Brand Management (Corporate Segment) and Studio Research & Analytics (Disney Entertainment Segment). Responsibilities Support global tracking studies to measure performance of our characters and franchises among kids and adults around the world Support custom research projects to help inform business decisions related to the strategic directions of our characters and franchises Conduct ad-hoc analyses to answer key business questions from Executive Leadership Leverage primary research, syndicated research and cross-segment data sources to develop a clear POV on the strengths/opportunities of franchises; work will be used to inform strategic initiatives (e.g. franchise strategies, tracking marketing programs, informing new initiatives) Assist in developing story-driven decks and occasionally presenting findings to partners across the organization Basic Qualifications 3+ years experience in a market research/consumer insights (focus on quant), consulting, strategy, or analytics role Ability to interpret and integrate insights from multiple data sources into a cohesive narrative Strong analytical skills Experience crafting presentations that clearly communicate data and research findings Experience presenting research findings to audiences familiar and unfamiliar with data and research Strong project management skills and ability to execute quality work within tight deadlines Strong verbal and written communication skills Ability to work in a team environment as well as independently Ability to work in an environment with multiple priorities Mature, enthusiastic, and demonstrates a strong collaborative yet consultative approach! Preferred Qualifications: Entertainment industry experience highly preferred, but not required Experience using statistical software packages like Q, SPSS, or similar is a plus, but not required Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience The hiring range for this position in California is $92,800 to $124,400 per year. The base pay actually offered will take into account internal equity and also may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. A bonus and/or long-term incentive units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to the full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered.

title: Advanced Analytics Consultant
description: Title: Advanced Analytics Consultant Department: Brain Trust (Advanced Analytics) Reports To: VP of Analytics Location: Flexible - offices in Seattle, WA and Los Angeles, CA Salary: $90,000 - $120,000 At Hypothesis, we blend insights, design, and strategy to help important brands do amazing things. We work with the world’s most dynamic, admired, and disruptive companies to answer their high-stakes questions and help build the future. We are a nimble, forward-leaning, independent agency whose culture empowers amazing people to do their best work. We’re a collection of researchers, strategists, designers, and marketers who are also musicians, travelers, astrophysicists, rock climbers, and gamers, with two big things in common: we love a good challenge, and we believe our ideas get better when we work together. What You’ll Do: As an Advanced Analytics Consultant, you will contribute to both the advanced analytics practice at Hypothesis, as well as serving as the quantitative expert to various project teams who conduct our research studies. Specifically, within this job you will… Understand and perform classic marketing research methods with complete autonomy (e.g. TURF, correlation/regression/derived importance, factor analysis, association maps, structure equation modeling) Understands and perform more complex market research analytics with some guidance(e.g. cluster analysis, including people/occasion segmentation, conjoint and discrete choice) Participate in the execution of ad-hoc analytic offerings in customer analytics, user experience, and fusion analytics that utilize machine learning, data query and automation techniques to bridge primary research data and behavior/database data Serve as the internal partner and analytic consultant to the Hypothesis project team, working with them to be a resource for questionnaire development, analytics methodologies, timelines, and story points/implications. Create Excel deliverables, simulators and reporting tools that can be client-ready (after project team notes and design team assistance) with minimal input direction from senior BT staff. Participate in client calls as the analytics representative to advise regarding study approach decisions, data interpretation, and implications. Manage multiple project commitments at the same time, raising time concerns about project timing weeks in advance to the senior members of the BT, so we can work together to resource our commitments. What You Have: Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field; advanced degree preferred 2+ years’ experience in a relevant field Experience with statistical analysis tools. Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy. Experience conducting statistical analysis with one of the following R, Python, SAS or Matlab. Can create successful codes from scratch. Visual Basic, SQL or SPSS a plus. Able to write clear and professional emails both internally and to clients. Able to quickly diagnose problems in a large dataset, summarize implications and prescribe solutions. What We Offer: We are premium. We embrace individuality. We are brave. We support each other. We are all empowered. We’re happy when our employees are happy and we understand that everyone needs a creative and positive work environment, time to themselves to recharge, time with family, or just a night to binge on Netflix. To that aim, we’ve put together the kind of generous benefits package you’d expect with some extras you might not expect. Flexible time off Remote/ Flexible work with optional office locations in Los Angeles and Seattle. 9 Paid Holidays Bonus 3-day weekends on those months we don’t have a scheduled holiday Health, Dental, Vision Healthcare & Dependent Care FSA 401K + 4% company match Employee Assistance Program Bi-Annual Performance Reviews 12 weeks paid Parental Leave Annual stipend for the first two years of new family member's daycare. Monthly Internet Stipend New Hire Home Office Stipend If you are someone from an under-represented group, or if you have unique talents or skillsets that make you well-suited for this position, we especially want you to apply. Hypothesis is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to bringing together humans from different backgrounds and perspectives, providing employees with a safe and welcoming work environment free of discrimination and harassment. We strive to create a diverse & inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and do impactful work together. Hypothesis participates in the federal government's E-Verify program. With E-Verify we are able to confirm the employment authorization of all newly hired employees through an electronic database maintained by the Social Security Administration and Department of Homeland Security. With respect to new hires, the E-Verify process is completed in conjunction with a new hire's completion of the Form I-9, Employment Eligibility Verification upon commencement of employment. E-Verify is not used as a tool to pre-screen candidates. For up-to-date information on E-Verify, go to www.uscis.gov and click on the 'E-Verify' logo.

title: Business Intelligence - SR
description: Summary SPATHE is looking for a qualified person to support our multi-year contract with US Navy SOF in support of their Enterprise Knowledge Management team responsible for leading all ongoing development and maintenance of business intelligence architecture that enables fact-based decision making and ad-hoc analysis and insight generation. Converts business requirements and high-level data collection needs into well-specified analyses, reporting and visualizations. Gathers BI requirements, design solutions, and works with developers on delivery. Engages as the SME on our selected platforms- including SQL Server, Microsoft Dynamics CRM, Power BI, along with SSRS, to successfully deploy business intelligence solutions to satisfy information requirements. Provide Analysis and Reporting Development and Support. Develop new enterprise business intelligence (BI) service offerings, content creation, and value propositions to support and improve Government business processes. Collaborate with end users to identify needs and opportunities for improved data management and delivery. Provide ongoing development and maintenance of an operational data store and enterprise data warehouse using BI best practices, relational structures, dimensional data modeling, structured query language skills, data warehouse and reporting techniques. Improve and streamline processes regarding data flow and data quality to improve data accuracy, viability and value. Provide ongoing development and maintenance of a BI architecture that enables fact-based decision making and ad-hoc analysis and insight generation. Provide interactive real-time dashboards and key performance indicators using Microsoft Power BI, SQL Server Reporting Services, Tableau, Sisense, SAP Crystal Reports, IBM Cognos, Qlik, or newly identified BI tools. Provide end-user support and encourage user adoption. Act as Tier 1 support for end users of BI tools. Train end-users on basic functionality. Direct users to training material and available resources. Requirements MA/MS Degree in Business Intelligence, Computer Science, or Data Analytics OR 10+ years of relevant experience. Clearance Secret or above Certifications Certified Business Intelligence Professional (CBIPR) desired. IAT Level II required (Security Plus). Physical Requirements N/A. Salary Range $115k- $130k Work Environment Work is generally done in office setting. Position ID - M3103BIS

title: Enterprise Systems Engineer (University Grad)
description: Enterprise Engineering is at the heart of Meta. By transforming the way businesses function, we are helping to bring billions of people around the world closer together. The mission of the Enterprise Infrastructure & Security (EIS) team is to provide best-in-class infrastructure, data, and security services to Meta and its partners. This requires unconventional thinking and lightning-fast, nimble solutions. We build enterprise products for Meta first.As one of the leading engineering teams in the enterprise world, our goal is to provide a solid foundation and platform for Meta businesses to build services and run workloads. As an Enterprise Systems Engineer, you will build the infrastructure for our high traffic, high visibility services. You will provide operational support for critical services that enable connected experiences found across Meta. We constantly review our processes, automate wherever possible, and develop our own toolchains when necessary. Join us and become part of a world-class team that allows Meta to deliver top-tier services to its employees. Enterprise Systems Engineer (University Grad) Responsibilities: Build, scale, and secure the Linux environment within Meta enterprise infrastructure, a heterogeneous environment containing diverse operating systems and applications. Apply modern engineering methodologies such as Infrastructure-as-Code, container orchestration, and software-defined storage Implement systems that are scalable, automated, monitored, and well-documented Find ways to leverage the scale and complexity of the larger Meta production infrastructure to solve problems for enterprise customers Participate in incident root cause analysis through multiple infrastructure layers (compute, storage, network). Minimum Qualifications: Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience. Degree must be completed prior to joining Meta. System administration experience working in a Linux environment Experience working with monitoring and configuration management tools such as Puppet and Chef Experience coding in at least one of the following languages: Python, Ruby, PHP, Rust, or Go Experience in shell scripting Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment Preferred Qualifications: Experience supporting configuration management in a multi-region environment Experience building services Experience building PaaS or internal clouds About Meta: Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics. Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. title: Reporting & Data Management Specialist
description: Department: Development Operations (Dev) Employment Type: Full Time Location: Napa Compensation: $70,000 - $95,000 / year Description Location: Remote Want to be a part of a fast-paced growing MSP that is fiercely committed to helping others thrive? A career with an IT Managed Service Provider (MSP) is a challenging thing, but also extremely rewarding! It’s fast-paced, like drinking from a firehose, but this gives you a tremendous opportunity for hands-on experience with the newest platforms and a range of unique environments. At all times we have each other's backs and want you to succeed and thrive. We know our most important assets are PEOPLE like you, and we’re looking forward to having you meet our team! Life at Endsight is about finding fulfillment for ourselves by fiercely committing to helping others thrive. We work for our clients and our colleagues with an ambition to pursue “excellent customer experiences at EVERY opportunity.” Our vision is to be a lot like a great university - a place where employees come, make life-long connections with other incredible people, and go through intense personal and professional growth; a place where the best people in the industry come to be treated with respect and are given the opportunity to do meaningful work. Benefits Medical: Company pays 100% of the base plan for the employee and family Dental & Vision 401(k) with employer matching Accrued Paid Time Off 9 Paid Holidays Career Pathing Key Responsibilities The role of the Reporting & Data Management Specialist as it relates to Managed Services consists of skills that are part Data Analyst and part Database Administrator, with a deep understanding of internal data systems in order to develop statistics and metrics that are important to a service provider. The Reporting Specialist responsibilities of this role includes the design of meaningful reports/dashboards/metrics and solutions that are based on the needs of the client, balancing value and economy with accuracy and efficiency. This role will collaborate with stakeholders to fully understand the problem being solved and offering advice and guidance on the options available, along with generating the output to achieve the end result. The Data Management Specialist responsibilities of this role include the management, maintenance, and integrity of internal back-end data systems as assigned, as well as serving as a valuable resource to both internal and external users on strategies and best practices to ensure the health, security, and efficiency of data systems. The technologies this role encompasses include, but are not limited to: SharePoint Power BI Power Apps Power Automate Dataverse Microsoft SQL

title: Consultant / Senior Consultant, Insights and Analytics
description: Blue Matter is a rapidly growing management consultancy focused in the biopharmaceutical industry. We partner with our clients to help them achieve commercial success across the lifecycle of their products, portfolios, and organizations. Our project types include providing decision support through insights and analytics for new product planning, launch strategy, portfolio / disease area strategy, and organizational strategy / change management. Most of our work is in specialty therapeutics, with oncology and rare diseases a specific area of expertise. We have a unique entrepreneurial culture and invest in building Blue Matter as the best place to work for our team. We have offices in NY, San Francisco, Boston, London, Zurich, Mumbai & Gurgaon. As a Consultant / Senior Consultant, you will work across Blue Matter as a functional expert, playing a key role in identifying analytical solutions to complex client needs. Primary Responsibilities As a key member of cross-functional client facing teams, develop and execute project plans to support initiatives that include, but are not limited to: Forecasting solutions (early-stage through post launch assets) Primary market research (quantitative, quali-quant, and qualitative) Scoping Research tool development Management of vendors fielding quant tools or executing program recruitment Raw data analysis and synthesis Model development, as applicable Story development, including deliverable readout development 3rd party raw data analysis (MMIT, IQVIA, etc.) Development of Budget Impact Models (payer / provider) in support of core strategy initiatives Development of traditional pharmaceutical Gross-to-Net models Government pricing impact projections (ASP, 340b, Medicaid Best Price, etc.) Financial projections pertaining to reimbursement policy changes (e.g., ASP reform, wastage penalties, drug pricing caps, etc.) Development of payer / provider contract strategy simulation models Inpatient DRG analysis Cost threshold analysis in support of NTAP applications Analytics in support of patient services (PAP and co-pay) programs Analytics in support of BD&L programs Desired Experience And Skills Demonstrated expertise in quantitative modeling involving pharmaceutical assets Demonstrated experience in execution of quantitative primary market research Familiarity with U.S. coverage, payment, and pricing dynamics (including government pricing) Familiarity U.S. site of care financial dynamics Advanced level analytical skills including quantitative modeling Familiarity with core 3rd party data sets involving provider unit data, payer access data, analog sales data, etc Ability to translate raw data analysis into impactful client presentations with actionable insights Excellent communication skills (internal and client facing) Preferred Qualifications: Advanced degree(s) (PhD, MD, MBA, or MS) 4 years of quantitative analytical experience Demonstrated ability to integrate business and industry knowledge in developing creative solutions Compensation: Base salary range: $120,000 - $190,000 per year . Generous incentive compensation structure . Benefits Package: 401k - generous employer match with immediate vesting and financial planning resources Comprehensive medical, dental and vision coverage options effective day 1 of employment Flexible spending account (FSA) or Health Savings Account (HSA) Company paid insurances including Short- and Long-Term Disability and Life insurance as well as additional voluntary options Paid parental leave for all new parents Health & Wellness Benefit (e.g., gym memberships; $1000 reimbursement annually) Employee Assistance Program Generous paid time off including vacation, sick days, floating and company holidays Blue Matter is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against otherwise qualified applicants on the basis of race, color, religion, ancestry, age (40 and over), sex (including gender identity, sexual orientation and pregnancy), national origin, disability, marital status, parental status, genetic information, political affiliation, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. title: Business Intelligence Engineer, Prime Video US
description: Description Prime Video offers customers a vast collection of movies, series, and sports—all available to watch on hundreds of compatible devices. U.S. Prime members can also subscribe to 100+ channels including Max, discovery+, Paramount+ with SHOWTIME, BET+, MGM+, ViX+, PBS KIDS, NBA League Pass, MLB.TV, and STARZ with no extra apps to download, and no cable required. Prime Video is just one of the savings, convenience, and entertainment benefits included in a Prime membership. More than 200 million Prime members in 25 countries around the world enjoy access to Amazon’s enormous selection, exceptional value, and fast delivery. Are you interested in shaping the future of entertainment? Prime Video's technology teams are creating best-in-class digital video experience. As a Prime Video technologist, you’ll have end-to-end ownership of the product, user experience, design, and technology required to deliver state-of-the-art experiences for our customers. You’ll get to work on projects that are fast-paced, challenging, and varied. You’ll also be able to experiment with new possibilities, take risks, and collaborate with remarkable people. We’ll look for you to bring your diverse perspectives, ideas, and skill-sets to make Prime Video even better for our customers. With global opportunities for talented technologists, you can decide where a career Prime Video Tech takes you! We are seeking a talented Business Intelligence Engineer to support the Prime Video US Science, Engineering, and Measurement Team. We are continuously raising the bar on the scientific rigor of marketing measurement and optimization through analytics, experiments, and models. In this role, you will be a strategic thinker with the ability to understand business strategy, provide business analysis, and demonstrate technical aptitude to create insightful and effective reporting. You should have technical skills, project management skills and the ability to multi-task and thrive in an energizing environment. Key job responsibilities Define and deliver reporting that supports the analytical needs of internal business leaders. Use analytical insights to help increase teams effectiveness against key strategic goals. Instrument measurement of key KPIs for the organization. Serve as business lead for the internal reporting. Provide business requirements across all business reports. Ensure clear communication and coordination across the business, finance and technical teams. A day in the life You will work with Marketing Managers, Audience Insights Specialists, Product Managers, Data Engineers, Data Scientists, and Economists. You will maintain pipelines and dashboards central to the decision-making of the Marketing organization. You will perform deep dives and provide specific recommendations related to our customers' interactions with marketing and Prime Video content. We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations: Culver City, CA, USA | Seattle, WA, USA Basic Qualifications 3+ years of analyzing and interpreting data with Redshift, Oracle, NoSQL etc. experience Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools Experience with data modeling, warehousing and building ETL pipelines Experience in Statistical Analysis packages such as R, SAS and Matlab Experience using SQL to pull data from a database or data warehouse and scripting experience (Python) to process data for modeling Preferred Qualifications Experience with AWS solutions such as EC2, DynamoDB, S3, and Redshift Experience in data mining, ETL, etc. and using databases in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us. Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $89,600/year in our lowest geographic market up to $185,000/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company.
