title: Database Analyst
description: A non-profit is looking for a Database Analyst to join their team in New York, NY. Compensation: $95-105k They are actively seeking an individual specializing in healthcare datasets, possessing an understanding of healthcare operations, to become an integral part of our dynamic team. The role will involve structuring and rationalizing data collection for the purpose of creating meaningful insights for the clinical practice. As a healthcare database analyst, you will be responsible for collecting, analyzing and interpreting healthcare data to provide insights and support decision-making processes within the clinical practice. This is crucial to enhance capacity to meet evolving business requirements. Reporting to the Chief Information Officer, this is an exempt, full-time, hybrid position located in the NYC headquarters. We offer a competitive salary and benefits. Responsibilities Data Collection: Gather and compile healthcare data from various sources, such as electronic health records (EHRs), claims databases, surveys, and other relevant sources. Data Analysis: Use statistical methods and data analysis techniques to identify patterns, trends, and correlations within the healthcare data. Apply data mining and predictive modeling techniques to extract meaningful insights. Data Interpretation: Analyze and interpret the results of data analysis to provide actionable recommendations to healthcare providers, administrators, and other stakeholders. Present findings in a clear and concise manner, using visualizations (dashboards) and reports. Performance Evaluation: Assess the performance of healthcare programs, interventions, and initiatives by analyzing relevant data. Identify areas for improvement and provide recommendations to enhance healthcare outcomes and efficiency. Quality Assurance: Ensure the accuracy, integrity, and reliability of healthcare data by implementing data quality control measures. Identify and resolve data inconsistencies or errors. Compliance and Privacy: Adhere to legal and ethical standards related to healthcare data privacy and security. Ensure compliance with relevant regulations, such as the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA). Collaboration: Collaborate with healthcare professionals, researchers, and other stakeholders to understand their data needs, gather business requirements, and provide analytical support. Work as part of a multidisciplinary team to address complex healthcare challenges. Continuous Learning: Stay abreast of advancements in healthcare analytics, data science, and healthcare policies. Communication: Effectively communicate complex data analysis concepts and findings to both technical and non-technical audiences. Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure data-driven decision-making. Designs, builds and maintains interoperability/interface connections between an EMR system and other applications (including NextGen, SAGE Intacct, Workforce Adaptive, Salesforce, Monday.com, Microsoft Systems, etc.). Other duties as assigned. Qualifications 3 years of electronic health record (NextGen preferred) and database experience (Microsoft SQL preferred). Knowledge of clinical workflows, including proficiency in CPT and ICD-10 coding systems. Experience with HL7 v2 or FHIR standards. Experience with interoperability middleware software (e.g. Mulesoft) and experience with SMART API implementation. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities for process optimization. Exceptional clinical business requirements gathering and analysis skills. Advanced expertise in statistics, analytic techniques, and predictive modeling. Understanding of organizational data flow and its impact on decision-making. Familiarity with data governance and stewardship best practices. Project Management and Change Management experience. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Education or experience with SQL, MS Power Automate, Crystal Reports and Data Visualization. Experience with Business Intelligence tools and analytic platforms preferred. Bachelor's degree required, CIS, MIS, IS, CS, or relevant field.

company: New York State Department of Health
title: Data Analyst 2 - 47537
description: Minimum Qualifications Non-competitive: one year of permanent service as a Data Analyst 1 OR bachelor’s degree in data or computer science, informatics, economics, statistics, mathematics, or a related field, and three years of experience* in data visualization, and statistical models and data mining tools. Data analytic skills and programming experience using languages and tools such as SAS, Python, R, Tableau, SQL, and others. Strong working knowledge of Microsoft applications including Teams, SharePoint, PowerAutomate and Lists. Familiarity with healthcare and public health data. Duties Description The Data Analyst 2 will work within the Development Unit under the Bureau of Informatics and Technology in the Center for Health Data Innovation. The Development Unit supports and implements strategic initiatives for CHDI, including development of a cloud analytics environment that will store data from multiple sources (including health plans, providers, and clinical data) in a central repository. This position will serve as Data Analyst 2 responsible for supporting operations of new environments and tools in support of the cloud analytics environment. Responsibilities will include managing and querying data related to operations and developing and automating reports and communications related to quality assurance, data pipeline and analytic product errors, data access and availability. This position will also support developing standard processes, tools, and reports for the cloud analytic environment to ensure that data pipelines and end products are developed, maintained, and accessed in a consistent way. Specific duties include but are not limited to: Develop and implement standard operational processes related to cloud environment infrastructure, tools and analytic products; Create monitoring processes, alerting and visualizations of data ingestion and access for data products and environments. Manage stakeholder communication related to operations; Analyze and report on cloud environment development and operations status. Leverage project reports and other data from internal and external stakeholders; Develop standards, processes, and protocols to develop and improve additional procedures related to cloud platform and data pipelines. Provide recommendations on improvement to current procedures and implement new processes with approved tools; and develop and maintain documentation related to infrastructure, data pipelines, products or applications. Additional Comments Work hours and telecommuting availability (50% maximum) for this position will be discussed during the interview process and are subject to operational needs and the telecommuting application process.
